senses.de: To find out a number or amount using math
senses.ex: I need to calculate the total cost of the trip.

Tips.title: Math Required
Tips.description: Use 'calculate' when math operations like addition or division are needed to get a result.
Tips.example: Please calculate the average score from these grades.

Tips.title: Objective Precision
Tips.description: 'Calculate' implies a precise outcome, not a guess or estimation.
Tips.example: We'll need to calculate the exact dosage for the medication.

senses.de: To predict something based on known information
senses.ex: They are trying to calculate the effect of the new tax law on their business.

Tips.title: Informed Prediction
Tips.description: Use 'calculate' for predictions based on data or evidence, not just intuition.
Tips.example: Analysts calculate that the company's revenue will double by next year.

Tips.title: Assessing Consequences
Tips.description: 'Calculate' can involve considering different variables to predict possible outcomes.
Tips.example: They failed to calculate the effects of weather on the event.

senses.de: To plan something in a clever way with a specific aim
senses.ex: His every move is carefully calculated to help his image.

Tips.title: Strategic Planning
Tips.description: 'Calculate' suggests a methodical and sometimes manipulative approach to planning.
Tips.example: The campaign's moves are calculated for maximum voter appeal.

Tips.title: Subtle Tactics
Tips.description: A 'calculated' action often implies careful thought to gain advantage.
Tips.example: Her response was a calculated attempt to sway public opinion.

senses.de: In computer science, to execute a series of operations on data
senses.ex: The program is written to calculate all possible combinations.

Tips.title: Data Processing
Tips.description: In computing, 'calculate' often refers to the computer executing operations on data.
Tips.example: The software calculates the optimal route in seconds.

Tips.title: Technical Context
Tips.description: Use 'calculate' to describe actions within computer programs or algorithms.
Tips.example: This function calculates the time complexity of the algorithm.

Cipher.wordDefinition:
Both calculate and cipher are related to doing numerical operations, but there are some differences in their meanings and connotations.

Cipher has more of a focus on encryption and decryption.

A cipher is a code or system of codes used to conceal information, such as in cryptography.

To cipher can mean to encode or decode messages using a cipher, or to use mathematical algorithms to secure data.

Calculate is a more general term for working with numbers, while cipher is more specific to coding and encryption.

Compute.wordDefinition:
Calculate and compute are both verbs that mean to use mathematical methods to find an answer.

Compute is typically used when referring to the use of technology or computers to solve the problem or perform a calculation.

For example, a computer can compute complex mathematical equations or analyze data sets to find patterns.

The difference between the two words is that calculate is often used when the process involves logic and reasoning, while compute implies the use of technology to solve the problem.

Count.wordDefinition:
Count simply means to determine the number of something. This can be used in everyday situations such as counting the number of people in a room, or the number of items in a grocery list.

Calculate is used when there is a more complex or rigorous problem to solve, while count is used when the goal is simply to determine the number of something.

Determine.wordDefinition: Determine means to come to a decision or conclusion after considering all the available information. It's applicable when you need to make a judgment or reach a conclusion, like determining which college to attend based on various factors.

Estimate.wordDefinition:
Estimate means to make an educated guess or prediction based on limited information or experience.

You would use estimate when you don't have all the information but need to make an informed guess, such as predicting the number of attendees at an event or the cost of a home renovation project.

Evaluate.wordDefinition:
Evaluate means to assess or figure out the value, quality, or importance of something or someone.

Conversely, if you are trying to determine whether a book is worth reading or not, you would evaluate the book based on factors such as its plot, characterization, writing style, and overall impact.

Figure.wordDefinition:
Figure is used when you estimate or guess something. For instance, if you want to know if you have enough money to buy something without actually calculating it, you would use the word figure.

You can also use figure when talking about a plan or an idea that you are developing.

Calculate involves using numbers and formulas to find specific information, while figure involves using your intuition or estimation to make a prediction or plan.

Reckon.wordDefinition:
Reckon is more informal and refers to making an estimate or guess about something.

It doesn't necessarily involve math or numbers. For example, you might reckon that it will take around 20 minutes to walk to the park.

Calculate is used when precise mathematical calculations are required, whereas reckon is used when making an estimate or a guess.

Tally.wordDefinition:
Tally means to count or add up a list of numbers or items. It is applicable in situations where you need to keep track of a quantity or keep a record.

For example, you might tally the number of votes in an election or tally the number of items in a inventory.

quotes.Text: I do like the thrill of risk-taking, but it's always carefully calculated. I have done many high risk undertakings, but I have always measured the stakes. Not feeding the fear nor the doubt. But I also believe that you need to fuel passion in whatever you do. This is what I am trying to teach my children today.
quotes.Title: Canadian Businessman
quotes.Name: Guy Laliberte

quotes.Text: My books should feel like you're getting a peek into a private world: a diary no one was meant to read. As soon as I start thinking, 'This book is going to be published,' my drawing becomes calculated and deliberate. It's one of the ways I trick myself.
quotes.Title: American Cartoonist
quotes.Name: Jeffrey Brown

quotes.Text: Anyone who thinks stuntmen are crazy is dead wrong. These guys are calculating. They rig things, they think about different ways of doing it... they're not afraid.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Hal Needham

quotes.Text: Four years of football are calculated to breed in the average man more of the ingredients of success in life than almost any academic course he takes.
quotes.Title: American Coach
quotes.Name: Knute Rockne

quotes.Text: I've never been one to carefully calculate my career decisions, to sit on the outside looking in. I go with my passion and what moves me.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Michael Douglas

quotes.Text: You can calculate the worth of a man by the number of his enemies, and the importance of a work of art by the harm that is spoken of it.
quotes.Title: French Novelist
quotes.Name: Gustave Flaubert

quotes.Text: I'm really calculating when it comes to these scripts - I'm really calculated about character behavior and dialogue.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Jeff Nichols

quotes.Text: Computers do the calculating to allow people to transform the world.
quotes.Title: British Businessman
quotes.Name: Conrad Wolfram

quotes.Text: Common sense is calculation applied to life.
quotes.Title: Swiss Philosopher
quotes.Name: Henri Frederic Amiel
